quotes.quote: You can grow apart from people very quickly.
Sometimes growing up also means growing apart.
It simply means that sometimes when people grow, they grow apart.
Sometimes the comfort of being in a relationship lulls you into mundane complacency, you become irrelevant in each other's lives. We call this phenomenon, growing apart.
That sad moment when you can feel you and your best friend slowly growing apart.
Seasons change, people grow together and grow apart, life moves on.
The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart.
I can feel us growing apart, I can feel us fading away.
Even with the best intentions, growing apart might just be an inevitable part of growing up.
All this time, I thought we were growing apart because I was leaving yiu  behind. But really it was the reverse. She was learning to lie. She was learning to love.
It's so easy to grow apart; marriage takes work.
True friends won't grow apart even if they don't everyday.
Our love grew till it ran out of room now it looks like we're growing apart.
Lately seems we've been growing apart I don't know how much more I can take this I feel like saying buh
We can play at being broken, we can play at being boys, you can hear it in our voice, we're growing up to grow apart.
Even though we are now growing apart, the art in our heart still wants.
My theory is that maybe if I keep my distance you'll start to miss me. But so far, we are just growing apart.
I miss how close we used to be, I hate how we grown apart.
Whenever you feel like we're growing apart, let's just go back, back.
And you know that we're growing apart, because you planted the seeds yourself.
We growing apart you growing irate stuck in the door of my state.
When he looks your way have we been growing apart everyday? all of a sudden i don't have any words to say.
To somewhere new and as they're glowing i keep growing apart.
I'm sorry I broke your heart but I can't help growing apart from you.
Growing apart where do I start you had my heart I'll be careful to let down my guard.
My tiger my heart we're growing apart we're trying to be friends.
Cause you you're growing apart taking this heart and making it two from one.
Growing apart you couldn't see your not the man I want to be stalemate time it was over.
So here you are older than them growing apart and I can only hope you find a reason for the grind.
Some people come into our lives and quickly go. Some stay for a while, leave footprints on our hearts, and we are never, ever the same.
Every friendship goes through ups and downs. Dysfunctional patterns set in; external situations cause internal friction; you grow apart and then bounce back together.
Growing apart doesn't change the fact that for a long time we grew side by side; our roots will always be tangled. I'm glad for that.
We grow apart because we grow in different stages and not all of our stages align.
That's how it started: a series of small hurts and excuses between two people that built up slowly, widening over time to form a vast and yawning divide.
Relationships will fall apart if only one person is trying to hold it together.
People change. People are selfish. People abandon you. Yes, it hurts. Yes, it is devastating at times. But ultimately it is not your fault.
